SENT.plain: OBJECTIVE: To observe the effect of electroacupuncture (EA) on the contents of hippocampal calcitonin gene-related peptide (CGRP) and neuropeptide Y (NPY) in cerebral ischemia (CI) rats
METHODS: Forty SD rats were randomly divided into normal control, sham operation (sham), model and EA groups with 10 cases in each
CI model was duplicated by middle cerebral artery occlusion
EA (2 Hz, 1 mA, continuous waves) was applied to "Shuigou" (GV 26) for 30 min, once daily for 5 days
Hippocampal tissue was taken for assaying the contents of CGRP and NPY with radioimmunoassay
RESULTS: Compared with sham group and normal control group, hippocampal CGRP content in model group decreased apparently (P<0.01), while NPY content of model group increased significantly (P<0.01)
Compared with model group, hippocampal CGRP in EA group increased considerably (P<0.01) and NPY content decreased obviously (P<0.01)
CONCLUSION: Electroacupuncture of GV26 can effectively adjust hippocampal CGRP and NPY contents in CI rats, which may contribute to its effect in improving cerebral ischemia
